column4: I've got a java app that gets ran through a sh script but everytime I try to run it, ubuntu asks me if I want to open the sh file, run in terminal or run
yeah, but isn't there a way to "remember" this setting?
make a shortcut to the script
I tried it but the same behaviour
in kde I can click on the desktop and go to 'create new -> link to application'
you must be doing it wrong
the path to the sh script is correct
it only has a "command" field where I can put the command to run
hrrm, I don't know much about gnome so i'm not sure what else you can do
